subject: Travel
title: Hanno the Navigator
description: Learn Hanno the Navigator in one minute.

hook.text: Around 500 BC, a Carthaginian admiral sailed through the Strait of Gibraltar with 60 ships.

buildup.text: Hanno's mission was to establish colonies along the west coast of Africa.

discovery.text: He sailed farther south than any Mediterranean sailor before, reaching modern-day Cameroon.

twist.text: He described encountering 'gorillai' â€” wild, hairy people. This is where the word gorilla comes from.

climax.text: His account was carved on a stone tablet in Carthage. It's the oldest surviving exploration log.

punchline.text: A voyage from 2,500 years ago named the gorilla.

quiz.question: What word originates from Hanno's voyage?
